special_abilities.name: Spellcasting
special_abilities.desc: The apprentice is a 1st-level spellcaster. Its spell- casting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following wizard spells prepared: Cantrips (at will): fire bolt, mending, prestidigitation 1st level (2 slots): burning hands, disguise self. shield

actions.name: Dagger
actions.desc: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +2 to hit , reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (ld4) piercing damage.

special_abilities.name: Spellcasting
special_abilities.desc: The bard is a 4th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 12, +4 to hit with spell at- tacks). It has the following bard spells prepared: Cantrips {at will): friends, mage hand, vicious mockery; 1st level (4 slots): charm person, healing word, heroism, sleep, thunderwave; 2nd level (3 slots): invisibility, shatter

special_abilities.name: Song of Rest
special_abilities.desc: The bard can perform a song while taking a short rest. Any ally who hears the song regains an extra ld6 hit points if it spends any Hit Dice to regain hit points at the end ofthat rest. The bard can confer this benefit on itself as well.

special_abilities.name: Taunt (2/Day)
special_abilities.desc: The bard can use a bonus action on its turn to target one creature within 30 feet of it. Ifthe target can hear the bard, the target must succeed on a DC 12 Charisma saving throw or have disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws until the start ofthe bard's next turn.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: S (ld6 + 2} piercing damage.

actions.name: Shortbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack:+4 to hit, range 80/ 320 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (ld6 + 2} piercing damage.

special_abilities.name: Keen Smell
special_abilities.desc: The carrion crawler has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

special_abilities.name: Spider Climb
special_abilities.desc: The carrion crawler can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The carrion crawler makes two attacks: one with its tentacles and one with its bite.

actions.name: Tentacles
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. Hit: 4 (1 d4 + 2) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for l minute. Until this poison ends, the target is paralyzed. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the poison on itself on a success.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Mefee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) piercing damage.

special_abilities.name: Avoidance
special_abilities.desc: If the displacer beast is subjected to an effect that allows itto make a saving throwtotake only halfdamage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only halfdamage if it fails.

special_abilities.name: Displacement
special_abilities.desc: The displacer beast projects a magical illusion that makes it appear to be standing near its actual location, causing attack rolls against it to have disadvantage. If it is hit by an attack, this trait is disrupted until the end of its next turn. This trait is also disrupted while the displacer beast is incapacitated or has a speed of 0.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The displacer beast makes two attacks with its tentacles.

actions.name: Tentacles
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 3 (1d6) piercing damage

special_abilities.name: Fey Ancestry
special_abilities.desc: The drow has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the drow to sleep.

special_abilities.name: Gunslinger
special_abilities.desc: Beingwithin5feetofahostilecreatureorattack· ing at long range doesn't impose disadvantage on the drow's ranged attack rolls with a pistol. In addition, the drow ignores half cover and three·quarters cover when making ranged at· tacks with a pistol.

special_abilities.name: Innate Spellcasting
special_abilities.desc: The drow's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 12). It can innately cast the following spells, re· quiring no material components: At will: dancing lights; 1/day each: darkness.faeriefire, levitate (selfonly)

special_abilities.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
special_abilities.desc: While in sunlight, the drew has disadvan· tage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The drow makes two shortsword attacks.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach S ft., one target. Hit: 7 (ld6 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Poisonous Pistol
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range 30/90 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (ldlO + 4) piercing damage plus 11 (2dl0) poison damage.

special_abilities.name: Agressive
special_abilities.desc: As a bonus action, the gazer can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

special_abilities.name: Mimicry
special_abilities.desc: The gazer can mimic simple sounds of speech it has heard, in any language. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful DC 10 Wisdom (In· sight) check.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 piercing damage.

actions.name: Eye Rays
actions.desc: The gazer shoots two of the following magical eye rays at random (reroll duplicates), choosing one or two targets it can see within 60 feet of it:

actions.name: 1. Dazing Ray
actions.desc: The target creature must succeed on a DC 12 Wisdom saving throw or be charmed until the start of the gazer's next turn.  While the target is charmed in this way, its speed is halved, and it has disadvantage on attack rolls.

actions.name: 2. Fear Ray
actions.desc: The targeted creature must suceed on a DC 12 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened until the start of the gazer's next turn.

actions.name: 3. Frost Ray
actions.desc: The targeted creature must succeed on a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw or take 10 (3d6) cold damage.

actions.name: 4. Telekinetic Ray
actions.desc: If the target is a creature that is Medium or smaller, it must succeed on a DC 12 Strength saving throw or be moved up to 30 feet directly away from the gazer. If the target is an object weighting 10 pounds or less that isn't being worn or carried, the gazer moves it up to 30 feet in any direction. The gazer can also exert fine control on ovjects with this ray, such as manipulating a simple tool or opening a container.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The grell makes two attacks: one with its tentacles and one with its beak.

actions.name: Tentacles
actions.desc: MeleeWeaponAttack:+4tohit,reach 10ft.,one creature. Hit: 7 (ldlO + 2) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 1 1 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. The poisoned target is paralyzed, and it can repeat the saving throw at the end ofeach of its turns, ending the effect on a success. The target is also grappled (escape DC 1 5). Ifthe target is Medium or smaller, it is also restrained until this grapple ends. While grappling the target, the grell has advantage on attack rolls against it and can't use this attack against other targets. When the grell moves, any Medium or smaller target it is grappling moves with it.

actions.name: Beak
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) piercing damage.

name: Kenku
languages: understands Auran and Common but speaks only through the use of its Mimicry trait

special_abilities.name: Ambusher
special_abilities.desc: In the first round of a combat, the kenku has advantage on attack rools against any creature it suprised.

special_abilities.name: Mimicry
special_abilities.desc: The kenku can mimic any sound it has heard including voices.  A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful DC 14 Wisdon (Insight) check.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weappon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Shortbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weappon Attack: +5 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

name: Intellect Devourer
languages: understands Deep Speech but can't speak, telepathy 60 ft.

special_abilities.name: Detect Sentience
special_abilities.desc: The intellect devourer can sense the presence and location ofany creature within 300 feet ofit that has an Intelligence of3 or higher, regardless ofinterposing barriers, unless the creature is protected by a mind blank spell.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The intellect devourer makes one attack with its claws and uses Devour Intellect.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) slashing damage.

actions.name: Devour Intellect
actions.desc: The intellect devourer targets one creature it can see within 10 feet of it that has a brain. The target must succeed on a DC 12 Intelligence saving throw against this magicortake11 (2dl0)psychicdamage.Alsoonafailure, roll 3d6: Ifthe total equals or exceeds the target's Intelligence score, that score is reduced to 0. The target is stunned until it regains at least one point of Intelligence.

actions.name: Body Theif
actions.desc: The intellect devourer initiates an Intelligence con­ test with an incapacitated humanoid within 5 feet of it that isn't protected by protectionfrom evil and good. If it wins the contest, the intellect devourer magically consumes the target's brain, teleports into the skull, and takes control ofthe body. While there, the intellect devourer has total cover against attacks and other effects originating outside its host. The intellect devourer retains its Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, as well as its understanding ofDeep Speech, its telepathy, and its traits. It otherwise adopts the target's statistics. It knows ev­ erything the creature knew, including spells and languages. Ifthe host body dies, the intellect devourer must leave it. A protectionfrom evil and good spell cast on the body drives the intellect devourer out. The intellect devourer is also forced out ifthe target regains its devoured brain by means ofa wish. By spending 5 feet of its movement, the intellect devourer can vol­ untarily leave the body, teleporting to the nearest unoccupied space within 5 feet of it. The body then dies, unless its brain is restored within 1 round.

special_abilities.name: Magic Resistance
special_abilities.desc: The mond flayer has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

special_abilities.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
special_abilities.desc:
The mind flayer's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 15). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:
 At will: detect thoughts, levitate
 1/day each: dominate monster, plane shift (self only)

actions.name: Tentacles
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 15 (2d10 +4) psychic damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is grappled (escape DC 15) and must succeed on a DC 15 Intelligence saving throw or be stunned until this grapple ends.

actions.name: Extract Brain
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one incapacitated humanoid grappled by the mind flayer. Hit: 55 (lOdlO) piercing damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the mind flayer kills the target by extracting and devouring its brain.

actions.name: Mind Blast
actions.desc: The mind flayer magically emits psychic energy in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 15 Intelligence saving throw or take 22 (4d8 + 4) psychic damage and be stunned for l minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end ofeach ofits turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

name: Nimblewright
languages: understands one language known to its creator but can't speak

special_abilities.name: Magic Resistance
special_abilities.desc: The nimblewright has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

special_abilities.name: Magic Weapons
special_abilities.desc: The nimblewright's weapon attacks are magical.

special_abilities.name: Repairable
special_abilities.desc: As long as it has at least l hit point remaining, the nimblewright regains l hit point when a mending spell is cast on it.

special_abilities.name: Sure-Footed
special_abilities.desc: The nimblewright has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock it prone.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The nimblewright makes three attacks: two with its rapie r and one with its dagger.

actions.name: Rapier
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hiti reach S ft., one target. Hit: 8 (ld8 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.desc: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack~+6 to hit, reach S ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) piercing damage.

reactions.name: Parry
reactions.desc: The nimblewright adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the nimblewright must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

name: Scarecrow
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

special_abilities.name: False Appearance
special_abilities.desc: While the scarecrow remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary, inanimate scarecrow.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The scarecrow makes two claw attacks.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (2d4 + 1) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened until the end ofthe scarecrow's next turn.

actions.name: Terrifying Glare
actions.desc: The scarecrow targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. Ifthe target can see the scarecrow, the target must succeed on a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw or be magically frightened until the end ofthe scarecrow's next turn. The frightened target is paralyzed.

special_abilities.name: Chameleon Skin
special_abilities.desc: The troglodyte has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide.

special_abilities.name: Stench
special_abilities.desc: Any creature other than a troglodyte that starts its turn within 5 feet ofthe troglodyte must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start ofthe creature's next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the stench of all troglodytes for l hour.

special_abilities.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
special_abilities.desc: While in sunlight, the troglodyte has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The troglodyte makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (ld4 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (ld4 + 2) slashing damage.
